column3: Back

I totally agree – that film was brilliant.
I totally agree, we should leave early.
I totally agree, coffee is better than tea.
I totally agree, this place is way too expensive.
I totally agree, Mondays are the worst.

I completely agree – remote work is the future.
I completely agree, the price is ridiculous.
I completely agree, we need more holidays.
I completely agree, cats are better than dogs.
I completely agree, that was the best decision.

Do you want another slice? "Absolutely."
"Should we book it?" "Absolutely."
"Is this the best pizza ever?" "Absolutely."
"Can you come tonight?" "Absolutely."
"More coffee?" "Absolutely."
column4: Do you want another slice? "Absolutely." "Should we book it?" "Absolutely." "Is this the best pizza ever?" "Absolutely." "Can you come tonight?" "Absolutely." "More coffee?" "Absolutely."

column3:
That’s exactly what I was thinking!
Exactly! That’s the problem.
Exactly! Why didn’t we do this sooner?
Exactly! It’s way too hot today.
Exactly! That’s my point.

You’re absolutely right, we should have left earlier.
You’re absolutely right, this tastes amazing.
You’re absolutely right, the meeting was pointless.
You’re absolutely right, eight o’clock is too late.
You’re absolutely right, summer is the best season.

Remote work saves time – I couldn’t agree more.
Exercise is important – I couldn’t agree more.
Sleep matters – I couldn’t agree more.
Travel is the best teacher – I couldn’t agree more.
Breakfast is key – I couldn’t agree more.

That’s a good point, traffic will be bad.
That’s a good point, we do need more time.
That’s a good point, the battery might die.
That’s a good point, it could rain.

You’ve got a point there, but it’ll still be fun.
You’ve got a point there, it is expensive.
You’ve got a point there, mornings are quieter.
You’ve got a point there, the train is faster.
You’ve got a point there, we should check first.

column1: I see where you’re coming from.
column3:
I see where you’re coming from, but I still want to go.
I see where you’re coming from, it does look risky.
I see where you’re coming from, the price is high.
I see where you’re coming from, but I love cities.
I see where you’re coming from, it’s a big change.

You don’t eat meat? Fair enough.
You want to stay home? Fair enough.
You prefer tea? Fair enough.
You hate horror films? Fair enough.
You’re tired? Fair enough.

Banning phones in class – I’m with you on that.
Cutting down plastic – I’m with you on that.
Early mornings are best – I’m with you on that.
Pizza beats pasta – I’m with you on that.
Summer holidays need to be longer – I’m with you on that.

She’s the best singer, no doubt about it.
This is the fastest route, no doubt about it.
He’s guilty, no doubt about it.
It’s going to rain, no doubt about it.
Chocolate is the best, no doubt about it.

Are you coming? "Definitely."
"Should we book?" "Definitely."
"Want more cake?" "Definitely."
"Is it worth it?" "Definitely."
"See you tomorrow?" "Definitely."
column4: Are you coming? "Definitely." "Should we book?" "Definitely." "Want more cake?" "Definitely." "Is it worth it?" "Definitely." "See you tomorrow?" "Definitely."

column3:
Four-hour meeting? I’m not sure about that.
Flying tonight? I’m not sure about that.
Eating out again? I’m not sure about that.
Ten o’clock start? I’m not sure about that.
Borrowing money? I’m not sure about that.

I don’t quite agree, we still have time.
I don’t quite agree, the film was okay.
I don’t quite agree, city life is exciting.
I don’t quite agree, coffee isn’t that bad.
I don’t quite agree, the price is fair.

I’m afraid I disagree, social media does harm.
I’m afraid I disagree, the plan won’t work.
I’m afraid I disagree, dogs are better.
I’m afraid I disagree, it’s too risky.
I’m afraid I disagree, mornings are awful.

I see your point, but I still want to try.
I see your point, but the risk is too high.
I see your point, but I prefer the city.
I see your point, but deadlines matter.

That’s not entirely true, it does save time.
That’s not entirely true, I was only five minutes late.
That’s not entirely true, some cats are friendly.
That’s not entirely true, the shop was open.

One week is enough? I’m not convinced.
He’s changed? I’m not convinced.
It’ll be ready tomorrow? I’m not convinced.
This diet works? I’m not convinced.

With respect, I think you’ve missed something.
With respect, I think the data is wrong.
With respect, I think we need more time.
With respect, I think the price is too high.
With respect, I think another approach would work better.

Everyone loves it, but I beg to differ.
It’s impossible? I beg to differ.
Cats are best? I beg to differ.
The meeting was useful? I beg to differ.
Summer is awful? I beg to differ.

"Are you tired?" "Not really."

"Cold today?" "Not really."
"Hungry yet?" "Not really."
column4: Do you like jazz? "Not really." "Are you tired?" "Not really." "Was it expensive?" "Not really." "Cold today?" "Not really." "Hungry yet?" "Not really."

column3:

column1: That’s not how I see it.
column3:
You think it’s funny? That’s not how I see it.
You call this art? That’s not how I see it.
You think it’s cheap? That’s not how I see it.
You think he’s honest? That’s not how I see it.
You think it’s easy? That’s not how I see it.

I’m not tired. On the contrary, I’m full of energy.
I don’t hate it. On the contrary, I love it.
It wasn’t boring. On the contrary, it was exciting.
She’s not shy. On the contrary, she’s very confident.
It’s not cold. On the contrary, it’s boiling.
